content.html:
Warm Up Activity

Graphs A, B, and C represent three linear equations:

\(y=2x+4\)

\(y=3-x\)

\(y=3x-2\)

Use the following graph to answer questions 1–3.

​ ​
  1. Which graph corresponds to equation \(y=2x+4\)?

Correct! The graph representing \(y=2x+4\) has a slope of 2 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at 4, so it is Graph B.

Incorrect. The correct answer is B.The graph representing \(y=2x+4\) has a slope of 2 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at 4, so it is Graph B.

​
  1. Which graph corresponds to equation \(y=3-x\)?

Correct! The graph representing \(y=3-x\) has a slope of -1 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at 3, so it is Graph A.

Incorrect. The correct answer is A.The graph representing \(y=3-x\) has a slope of -1 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at 3, so it is Graph A.

​ ​
  1. Which graph corresponds to equation \(y=3x-2\)?

Correct! The graph representing \(y=3x-2\) has a slope of 3 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at -2, so it is Graph C.

Incorrect. The correct answer is C.The graph representing \(y=3x-2\) has a slope of 3 and intersects the \(y\)-axis at -2, so it is Graph C.
